method.name: PUT
method.doc: The MAC OTP mechanisms must be correctly configured before the policy workflow can successfully respond to any runtime requests. Information about its configuration is available under the Configuring Authentication topics of the IBM Knowledge Center.

PUT requests are used to verify credentials. Once a valid authentication state context has been established for a policy that includes the MAC OTP authentication mechanism, and that mechanism is current for the active state, then the requester may validate the MAC OTP.

The requester sends a PUT request to the authentication service API endpoint. The URI includes a dynamically generated state identifier. The URI can be easily obtained from the 'location' attribute from the previous JSON response data.
